src/internal/BeforeAfterWrapper.js
styles
description:
BeforeAfterWrapper An alternative for the ::before and ::after css pseudo-elements for components whose styles are defined in javascript instead of css. Usage: For the element that we want to apply before and after elements to, wrap its children with BeforeAfterWrapper. For example:
// See notice renders
// before element [children of paper] ------> [children of paper]
// after element
Notice: Notice that this div bundles together our elements. If the element that we want to apply before and after elements is a HTML tag (i.e. a div, p, or button tag), we can avoid this extra nesting by passing using the BeforeAfterWrapper in place of said tag like so:

do this instead [children of p] ------> [children of p]

BeforeAfterWrapper features spread functionality. This means that we can pass HTML tag properties directly into the BeforeAfterWrapper tag. When using BeforeAfterWrapper, ensure that the parent of the beforeElement and afterElement have a defined style position.

renderLayer
description:
By calling this method in componentDidMount() and
componentDidUpdate(), you're effectively creating a "wormhole" that
funnels React's hierarchical updates through to a DOM node on an
entirely different part of the page.

minMaxPropType
description: Verifies min/max range.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} Returns an Error if min >= max otherwise null.

params.name: props
params.description: Properties of the React component.

params.name: propName
params.description: Name of the property to validate.

params.name: componentName
params.description: Name of the component whose property is being validated.

return.description: Returns an Error if min >= max otherwise null.

name: valueInRangePropType
description: Verifies value is within the min/max range.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} Returns an Error if the value is not within the range otherwise null.

params.name: props
params.description: Properties of the React component.

params.name: propName
params.description: Name of the property to validate.

params.name: componentName
params.description: Name of the component whose property is being validated.

return.description: Returns an Error if the value is not within the range otherwise null.

clamp
description: Returns a number whose value is limited to the given range.

unknown.tagValue: {number} A number in the range [min, max]

params.name: value
params.description: The value to be clamped

params.name: min
params.description: The lower boundary of the output range

params.name: max
params.description: The upper boundary of the output range

return.description: A number in the range [min, max]

name: convertColorToString
description: Converts a color object with type and values to a string.

params.name: color
params.description: Decomposed color

params.name: color.type
params.description: One of, 'rgb', 'rgba', 'hsl', 'hsla'

params.name: color.values
params.description: [n,n,n] or [n,n,n,n]

name: convertHexToRGB
description: Converts a color from CSS hex format to CSS rgb format.

params.name: color
params.description: Hex color, i.e. #nnn or #nnnnnn

name: decomposeColor
description:
Returns an object with the type and values of a color.

Note: Does not support rgb % values.

unknown.tagValue: {{type: string, values: number[]}} A MUI color object

params.name: color
params.description: CSS color, i.e. one of: #nnn, #nnnnnn, rgb(), rgba(), hsl(), hsla()

name: getContrastRatio
description:
Calculates the contrast ratio between two colors.

Formula: http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#contrast-ratiodef

unknown.tagValue: {number} A contrast ratio value in the range 0 - 21 with 2 digit precision.

params.name: foreground
params.description: CSS color, i.e. one of: #nnn, #nnnnnn, rgb(), rgba(), hsl(), hsla()

params.name: background
params.description: CSS color, i.e. one of: #nnn, #nnnnnn, rgb(), rgba(), hsl(), hsla()

return.description: A contrast ratio value in the range 0 - 21 with 2 digit precision.

name: getLuminance
description:
The relative brightness of any point in a color space,
normalized to 0 for darkest black and 1 for lightest white.

Formula: https://www.w3.org/WAI/GL/wiki/Relative_luminance

unknown.tagValue: {number} The relative brightness of the color in the range 0 - 1

params.name: color
params.description: CSS color, i.e. one of: #nnn, #nnnnnn, rgb(), rgba(), hsl(), hsla()

return.description: The relative brightness of the color in the range 0 - 1

name: emphasize
description:
Darken or lighten a colour, depending on its luminance.
Light colors are darkened, dark colors are lightened.

unknown.tagValue: {string} A CSS color string. Hex input values are returned as rgb

params.name: color
params.description: CSS color, i.e. one of: #nnn, #nnnnnn, rgb(), rgba(), hsl(), hsla()

params.name: coefficient
params.description: multiplier in the range 0 - 1

return.description: A CSS color string. Hex input values are returned as rgb

name: fade
description:
Set the absolute transparency of a color.
Any existing alpha values are overwritten.

unknown.tagValue: {string} A CSS color string. Hex input values are returned as rgb

params.name: color
params.description: CSS color, i.e. one of: #nnn, #nnnnnn, rgb(), rgba(), hsl(), hsla()

params.name: value
params.description: value to set the alpha channel to in the range 0 -1

return.description: A CSS color string. Hex input values are returned as rgb

name: darken
description: Darkens a color.

unknown.tagValue: {string} A CSS color string. Hex input values are returned as rgb

params.name: color
params.description: CSS color, i.e. one of: #nnn, #nnnnnn, rgb(), rgba(), hsl(), hsla()

params.name: coefficient
params.description: multiplier in the range 0 - 1

return.description: A CSS color string. Hex input values are returned as rgb

name: lighten
description: Lightens a color.

unknown.tagValue: {string} A CSS color string. Hex input values are returned as rgb

params.name: color
params.description: CSS color, i.e. one of: #nnn, #nnnnnn, rgb(), rgba(), hsl(), hsla()

params.name: coefficient
params.description: multiplier in the range 0 - 1

return.description: A CSS color string. Hex input values are returned as rgb
